noun.description: Biology and Anatomy. A small branch; specifically a branch belonging to a second (or higher) order of branching.

Botany. In certain plants belonging to the subfamily Tristichoideae of the family Podostemaceae: a photosynthetic organ with scaly leaves, variously considered to be homologous to a shoot or a compound leaf, or intermediate between these.

origin: Late 17th century. From classical Latin rāmulus little branch, twig from rāmus branch + -ulus.
